external.description:
Alt: This CVE may not be too terrifying, since it requires someone to run Invoke-WebRequest without -UseBasicParsing to some booby trapped hypothetical page that does not yet exist.

But the update cycle is real.

Every module that uses Invoke-WebRequest and supports 5.1 will have to be updated, and that will cause a lot of little IT update headaches as it rolls across the industry.  

Not everyone will do it, and an attacker will be more incentivized to start exploiting the loophole before it closes completely.

The moral of the story is:

Update it if you need to.

If you use Invoke-WebRequest on 5.1, give your code a once-over and make sure you -UseBasicParsing.

And update any module that you need to update everywhere you can.

The race is on.

Best win it before attackers do.
external.title: elmo is standing in front of a fire with the words `` so it begins '' .

record.text:
